39383707.review:
Rating: 7/10 (“Good”)

Recommended for: People who enjoy VNs, people who enjoy romance. I would recommend this for a first time VN-reader.

My route order: Lance > Yuri > Yeonho > Tei > Red > Secret endings. Yuri and Tei were my favourites.

Nameless is a Korean otome game that took me about 38 hours to complete. There are five routes and two secret endings in total. Each route branches off of a fairly short common route; the bulk of the game is definitely in the character-specific portions. The game is mostly lighthearted with touches of dark subject matter. Most of the issues it points out can be fairly poignant and hit close to home, such as being accepted by friends, and being true to yourself and your own interests. Naturally, this is all set in a high school setting.

The game is translated, and it’s obvious. The grammar is often spotty, though never incomprehensible. There are a few occasionally amusing misspellings such as “fiends” instead of “friends”. I can’t speak for the Korean to English translation as I don’t know Korean; however, I had no problem whatsoever grasping the story and felt emotionally moved during some parts.

Nameless’ art is a mixed bag. The highest quality artwork would definitely be the sprites (which for the most part are very good, especially Soi and Shinbi) and the CG art in the common route. The backgrounds are, mostly, lacklustre, and some are very simple. The most disappointing aspect of the artwork is that the CGs for the individual character routes are lower quality than those in the common route. It ends up being awkward and not as clean-looking. For a game with this price tag, that is rather annoying. It feels like a letdown for the common route art to be so pretty whilst the character-specific art is not as good.

The soundtrack is probably Nameless’ best technical feature. There are several different vocal themes for the endings depending on which character route you’re playing through. In addition, the music played throughout the game was mostly enjoyable. There were a few tracks I didn’t like; however, overall, I was never bored, and the soundtrack itself is something I don’t regret purchasing. The music fit the scenes they were in and some were delightfully creepy. I enjoyed the voice actors in the game and thought they fit their characters pretty well.

The writing is, for the most part, decent. The game treats restarting and choosing a new route in a rather interesting way, and occasionally breaks the fourth wall. The characters themselves (arguably the most important part) are generally likable. Tei, Yuri, and Yujin (not dateable) were my favourites. The characters I liked least were Yeonho and, by far, Red. I simply don’t like characters such as him and it was somewhat irritating that I was forced to do his route last. However, it’s understandable, given that the most plot-heavy material is left for his route. In addition, I did manage to warm up to him a bit by the end, though not enough to LIKE him. In that sense, I actually felt rather relieved when his route ended. Preferences notwithstanding, the characters were written competently and most of them had believable issues and personalities, though some did stray into the melodramatic. Each character has one good ending and at least two bad endings.

The plot moves along at a passable pace, though some events do repeat through routes (such as the school festival and visiting the amusement park), which makes the game feel a little repetitive at times. The heroine, Eri, is adequate, though there are multiple misunderstandings that occur through different routes that basically rely on her denseness or stupidity to work. It’s rather exasperating watching two characters fumble about with ridiculous issues that could be resolved if they simply communicated, but, such is the game and many VN protagonists. The secret endings, only available after reading all the routes, were…disappointing. I wish that, combined, they had at least been as long as an individual character route. However, there is a drama CD that supposedly takes place after the secret endings, so perhaps that will quell my annoyance.

Overall, Nameless was an enjoyable game, though plagued by some repetitiveness. I suppose that can’t be helped given the setting, however. Either way, I had a fun time with it, and I’d recommend it to those who enjoy otome or romance.

P.S. Fun (?) fact: "Yuri" is the name I use for unnamed otome heroines. It was a little jarring to see a love interest named "Yuri", hahah.

39325090.review:
I really like Cheritz as a company, but this game really just didn't cut it for me. I've played Yuri and Lance's routes only but I know what happens in the other routes since I read about them rather than taking the time to play them.

Yuri's route moves very awkwardly, it somehow goes from moving too fast to moving too slow to moving too fast. I didn't find him particularly interesting, although his "type" of character is usually my favorite. In my opinion by the end of Yuri's route not enough of the story was made clear. I want to avoid spoilers but there were some aspects of the route that were confusing that weren't made clear in the end.

Lance's route I found enjoyable for the most part, I don't have any specific complaints about it.

Tei and Yeonho are both very, I don't know if 'morbid' is the right way to describe their characters but that's the only thing I can think of. I was warned by a friend about content in both of their routes so I read about both before hand before deciding I didn't feel comfortable playing them. I know some people may be into their kinds of characters but just as a fair warning, if yandere types make you uncomfortable they both enroach on yandere territory.

Red I don't have any interest in because I just find him to be an annoying character.

I, again, love Cheritz as a company but this game is just a lot of reading but I didn't really get much enjoyment for the amount there was to read.

39133584.review:
A masterpiece.
I already knew Cheritz from Mystic Messenger (it can be downloaded for free on Play Store or App Store), and for the past months, I've been dragged into the otome games' world. MysMes is an excellent game (believe me or not, this app is now part of my life, if I don't open it at least once everyday I feel bad, because MM is my favorite game), but when I found out that Cheritz made other games, I felt that they would be just as great.
And I was right.
I loved Nameless from the start to the end. My favorite aspects:
- An incredible design: seriously, the characters are just so beautiful that's unfair (and yeah, I'm talking to you, Yuri. Who gave you permission to steal my heart the first moment you appeared?)
- The OST is breathtaking: I particullary liked Yuri's theme the most, of course, after the opening song, 'If I Could'. But all the songs are great.
- The relationships are well-made: a lot of otome games just hurry and kind of force the relationship between the MC and the pursued character, but Nameless isn't like that. The routes focus on healing the scars from the dolls before they can really start a romantic relationship. This shows that, for Eri, being a girlfriend is less important than being a good friend and owner. It's heartwarming.
- The backstory is wonderful and made me cry: the dolls' backstory and ???'s too. Cheritz, you've made me cry so much until now!
- MC is great: Eri is my favorite MC from all otome games I've played so far. She is always ready to take action, care about her dolls, is kind but strong at the same time. She runs away from the stereotype of 'the dumb and confused girl in love'. Well, Cheritz's MCs are like this, but I don't know why Eri caught my attention the most.
- The characters are so loveable: gahh, why are they not real? I'm seriously in love with them, when will the law allow marriage with fictional characters?
Thank you very much for this wonderful game, Cheritz!

39024539.review:
3/5


When I first purchased Nameless, I really crossed my fingers because I'm not very fond of Cheritz's games. However, I don't regret it at all! Unlike many other otome games I've played, you don't need to outwardly agree with the boy you're dating. The choices set you up in a way that feels like it's not you picking one of the guys, but the guys picking you. The atmosphere of the game feels very realistic and personal- which is ironic because all of them are dolls. 


PROS:

-relatable and enjoyable characters, especially the heroine!
-several endings and albums
-lengthy
-incredible art 
-fantastic voice acting throughout the game
-interesting concepts

CONS:

-there's definitely better otome games for cheaper or the same price
-in my [i]personal opinion[/i], the character designs don't suit the characters' archetypes and don't entirely make sense
-audio levels need to be adjusted from title screen dialouge vs in game dialouge & bgm
-unneccessary dialogue vs few choices

Overall, a fun game with interesting choices and an extremely unique concept. This game tackles many deep issues that pulls at the heart strings but is also full of many doki-doki moments!

38535770.review:
With Cheritz you can't go wrong! the same Devs behind Mystic Messenger. 

Characterization wise the cast represent a wide range of personalities; the Dolls each have their unique traits and each have their own dark side, which really makes the game more than a 'dating sim'. The side characters also add to the atmosphere and present fun and engaging dialogue instead of just being space fillers.

The game explores complex emotions of inferiority and fear of abandonement, and the way the gameplay is done makes it easier to play all the routes without getting too bored (all thanks to the 'skip read' function), you are motivated to finish all routes to get to the bottom of the story and uncover the myster behind the dolls.

38201065.review:
After clearning the game, the first thought that came across to me was: "I am sooo sorrry my Chicken Little doll that I used to have when I was youngggg" DDDD: 

The next thing I did was googling Crobidoll... 

This game was really good. I tried various otome games in the past, but this is I think one of my top games for the following reasons:

1. This is the first game that ever smoothly explained why a protagonist can date so many guys in one overarching story.

2. Great story for all the characters (even the side characters!). They all had their unique personality and background. The main characters all had their flaws that they eventually overcome with the protagonist. The protagonist also grows and learns crucial components in life throughout your playing. It was nice to see that and not just resetting the game to clear another character.

3. Perfect voice acting. Even the side characters. 

4. Beautiful graphics. I couldn't help myself from screenshotting while playing. They are all saved in my Steam cloud private profile muhaha

5. Nice music. I loved the sound effects as well.


However, I didn't like the game in parts where:

1. Kinda cheesy/corny parts in the story. Perhaps because the setting is in high school? Gosh. the HOT5? Ugh. But I was the person who hated Boys Over Flowers manga and drama, so idk. Some people may like the corny parts.

2. The proportions of the CGs looked a little funny in some of the characters. I wonder if there was some favoritism going on with the graphic team...

3. The story was kinda dark for my taste, but hey it's also just a personal preference. I could see how some people would really love this type of story.

I would still definitely recommend this game, though.

I think I bought this when it was on sale, so maybe $30 can shy some people away. 

If you have time, money, and interests in characters with unique story, I would highly recommend this game to you.

The stories range from fluffy and cute to down right disturbing with certain bad ends, and at times I found the routes to be boring until the plot picked up, but I defintely recommend taking the time and finishing the entire game regardless.

37764383.review:
I regret not buying this game sooner. I have wanted this game for a long while now but I just never could bring myself to get it out of fear I wouldn't like it. Funny enough I recently stumbled upon Mystic Messenger naturally (oblivious to the previous hype of it) and from there I loved that game so much I checked out what other games Cheritz had to offer. Lo and behold, Nameless was one of them. It also happened to be on sale at the time, so I promptly purchased it and my social life disappeared until I finished the game. This game has an amazing story. Admittedly I felt like it took a bit to actually take off. The first route I went on I was a slightly not into it at the beginning but it’s the little bits and pieces of the whole story that really hooks you.


There are a few things to take into consideration when buying this game:
-There are some spelling and grammar errors (this may bother some people, I’m honestly so bad at both that I rarely noticed these errors and it didn’t affect my play through)
-It’s about 40 hours long (If you’re a person who usually can’t put down a book, make sure you have the time to finish it)
-Some of the themes in game are a little tough to swallow 
-You may end up considering buying a $500+ doll after this game.
-You may also need to have some tissues near by 
-Sometimes the original Korean text is still there? It may be a glitch.

However, this game is definitely worth the buy.

36261065.review:
This game in my aspect is highly recommended. The stroylines are great and the details amongst the chapters are very adequate, plus with 5 boys to play from with long routes, you should not get bored by the rpg itself. The artwork is very beautiful with it's detailed colorings and shadings. Yet, going back into the game itself, it's something that surprised me. I mean, I would've never expected what I did from an otome harem game. Each boy's backstories are extremely emotional, and it pulled so many of my nerves making me into a complete mess with the game's capacity to share so many emotons with it's players. You may think of just wanting to get straight into the best ending as possible into an otome game, yet this game reveals so many more things about these characters in the bad endings as well. Getting deeper into the stories, it just fascinated me with how beautifully scripted this otome game was. I would've never expected as much as I gotten into one rpg itself. Cheritz has have outdone themselves in this wonderful and gorgeous creation. 10/10 recommended. 

+Beautiful voices
+Gorgeous characters
+Exciting and fun stories with interesting back stories 
+Amazing writing
+Emotional rollercoasters 
+Funny moments (Especially from Red)
+Heartfelt love confessions
+Outstanding artwork
+Lovely background music
+Lots of endings 
+Long stories (it's hard to get bored)
+Teary eyed events
+Happy times that'll make you smile
+Great opening prologue 
-Cliffhangers 
-Slow paced at times

36157130.review:
¡HEEEEEY! NO DUDEN Y COMPREN ESTE JUEGO.

¿Por que?

Hablare un poquito sobre el:

Se necesita un ingles basico y comprendimiento basico-medio (segun mi punto de vista) para entenderlo pues es obvio que no esta al español (deberia de, wno).
Con eso pueden comenzar su historia, recomiendo muchas golosinas, alguien paciente con quien contar para decirle los sucesos que os gusten y una caja de pañuelos.
La historia es genial, no dire mas, lo de juguetes con vida se ha visto en otros medios y con un poquito de esta formula pero es disfrutable. 

Los personajes tienen personalidades unicas y distintas que causan un cariño hacia ellos, la MC es genial, ahr.
El arte es bonito, pero en mi punto de vista muchas expresiones faciales de los personajes en fotos se veian... Raras. La musica, ¡oh! No es muy molesta, es agradable aunque si, escucharla muchas veces medio cansa.
Los botones de AUTO y SKIP son aliados indispensables cuando se quiere no presionar mucho el raton o necesita hacer rapido una parte (advierto que SKIP tiene un extraño bug que no te permite usarlo en seguida). 

Eso seria todo, en serio, me encanto, fascino mucho. Deseo comprar el DLC de navidad, no me importaria escuchar todo el 24 de diciembre esos audios, really. Es un trabajo bueno, Cheritz, felicidades.

36111773.review:
일단 풀보이스에 33000원이면 사야합니다. 그 어딜가도 풀보이스에 이 가격은 말이 안됩니다. 
물론 오글거린다거나 손발이 모으려지는 부분은 있었습니다. 하지만 원래 이런 장르의 오토메게임은 자고로 오글거리는 맛에 하는 법이죠. 그정도는 감수하시고 할만큼 가치가 있다 저는 생각합니다.
무엇보다 CG...저는 오토메게임 잘생긴 캐릭터를 보기 위해서 그리고  제작자분들이 손수 한땀한땀 그리시는 CG를 모으기 위해서 합니다. 그리고 올클리어 후 다 모은 CG 앨범을 봤을 떄의 만족감과 쾌감을 즐깁니다. 그리고 이 게임을 그런 저의 니즈를 충족시켜줬습니다. 저와 같은 분들은 사세요 후회 안합니다.
이번 추석연휴 즐겁게 잘보냈고 밤을 새가며 플레이 했습니다. 얼굴존잘, 목소리 존잘들이 많아서 플레이 내내 행복했습니다. 저는 이 게임 추천합니다.

36086358.review:
Cheritz tiene otro juego en steam que también he jugado (Dandelion) y está muy bien pero este es mucho mejor. De entrada no tiene stats, ni planificaciones ni cosas que distraigan de la historia. Y es una que merece la pena jugar. Lo recomiendo 100%.

[u]Personajes y rutas [/u]: OMG LANCE... Tenía que empezar por ahí, lo siento. Sigamos, los personajes son increíbles. De entrada hay tres historias para iniciar: Lance (!!!), Yuri y Yeon-ho. Tienen una ruta conjunta hasta cierto punto (4-5 capítulos aprox.) y después ya se dividen. Las otras dos van después y ya no comparten la misma ruta común. Se puede jugar la de Tei y Red sin hacer hecho las primeras tres, sí, se puede. Por historia quizás tendría más sentido hacer las otras tres primero, pero sois am@s de vuestros destinos así que a vuestra elección.

[u]Gráficos y CG[/u]: Los cg's con una calidad y dibujo muy buenos. Buenos fondos, los personajes son preciosos, pestañean, hay efectos graciosos (fijaros en Soi cuando está enamorada, muy divertido), se sonrojan. Y seguro que me dejo más cosas. No dan una sensación muy estática, no sólo por los parpadeos sino que tienen varias poses diferentes (no aparecen siempre igual). La calidad en este apartado es magnífica y la paletas de colores que utiliza resulta agradable. Si quieres conseguir todos los CG's es posible que tengas que consultar alguna guía para encontrar alguno en concreto sin volverte loc@.

[u]Voces y sonido[/u]: Tiene (en coreano) y se pueden desactivar por personajes quien no las quiera. Además se puede regular desde dentro del juego el volumen de las voces, efectos de sonido y música. La música va cambiando y va acorde a la situación.

[u]Historia[/u]: Las historias son muy buenas y todas ellas tienen recuerdos más o menos diferentes de la infancia de Eri (o el nombre que os pongáis, porque se puede cambiar). Todas ellas son importantes y están ligadas a los personajes de la ruta. Y es difícil decir más sin hacer spoilers. Tiene momentos enternecedores y cálidos, y otros un poco más dramáticos e impactantes. En resumen, está bastante bien y así como en Dandelion quedaba un poco más forzado todo el hilo argumental, en este no da esa impresión de una forma tan directa.

[u]Menús del juego y guardado[/u]: Muchas páginas y espacios de guardado, lo que pueda llegar a ser un lío en manos de alguien caótico pero bien llevado te permite guardar todas las rutas sin sobreescribir. Lo que sí encuentro a faltar es alguna clase de indicación que te diga el estado de la relación. Aunque cuando te sale GAME OVER tras una respuesta, es fácil deducir que no era buena. Recomiendo que si no usáis una guía (y no hace falta seguirla), guardéis y probéis con algunas segundas o terceras respuestas para tener todos los CG's.

Si me dejo algo, espero darme cuenta y rehacerlo. Espero que l@s que os decidáis a jugar este juego, lo disfrutéis mucho. Para mí es el mejor otome que he jugado y él único que tras jugar una historia en concreto hace años, me hizo no querer jugar las otras después. Pero bueno, quería hacer la reseña así que esta vez lo compré en mi cuenta de steam y las jugué todas. Merece la pena pero Lance será la última ruta esta vez también.

[b]100% recomendado[/b]

34505970.review:
This is the first Otome I've ever played where order is Super Important in understanding the story. It had enough moments that I really liked that I'm okay with that, but at the same time it's so far one of my least favorites of all the ones I've finished.

Lance, Yuri and Red's routes are certainly my favorites - while Red's would easily be my favorite, the circumstances of it are exceptionally frustrating and I had to fight the urge to throw my computer out of a 3rd story window. (Also, tbh Tei and Yeonho are not my typical types to begin with and their backgrounds were... messy.

It's a great game if you're low on your daily dose of angst, frustration, and the extreme desire to stab a teddy bear.
It's a decent game if you're looking for an interesting, interwoven, and over-arcing story line with that I think is possibly a happy ending.
It's an awful game if you're looking for something safe. It's not. It's not like adults only kind of unsafe, it's like "JFC, well that's twisted." kind of unsafe.

This game has both made me interested in ball-jointed dolls, and at the same time I'll never own a doll and am now convinced my teddy roxbin was, in fact, plotting my murder.

34434276.review:
+ Points for using a premise that justifies the characters' "love involves wanting to own the other party" thing--they're literally dolls; what are they supposed to think? (Still, calling someone your "owner" or "doll" in the middle of a confession scene is definitely a mood-killer, if not kinda creepy.)

+ Both of the MC's friends genuinely care about her in every route and are pretty great overall. Even if Soi frequently goes beyond the pale.

- God, so many typos. Who was responsible for proofreading this? Were they doing double duty on some other role in the localization team?

- One of Yeonho's bad endings involves [spoiler]the MC picking up where his previous abuser left off.[/spoiler] Having to intentionally choose to do that if you want to 100% the game is....icky, to put it lightly.

- A noticeable number of the CGs have kind of weird proportions.

- I enjoy the horror-movie-esque feeling of seeing MCs miss behavioral red flags, but not quite to the degree shown in Tei's route. [spoiler]Did she ever actually figure out how manipulative he is...?[/spoiler]

- Not being able to date Shinbi is tragically disappointing, since she's clearly better than any of the actual love interests.


Overall, unless you [b]like[/b] controlling, obsessive love interests, I'd say give this one a pass; it won't be worth $30. But I haven't played many otome games...maybe it's the best of a bad lot?

32745513.review:
It's a rather long review this time..

I don't really know, how to review this because for me until now the game has no real flaws.
I mean, I love Cheritz. I simply love the games they make.
From Mystic Messenger (that consumed half of my life)
to now this jewel here.
I got it via steam recommendation because of Amnesia (which is also a game I adore)
And it simply mesmerized me - it was steam summer sale - heck yeah, Cheritz, let's buy it!

So I started off with Yuri (well I didn't finished the game yet, but I don't think that the game will disappoint me after the most, well, not-story-based route) and I think it is one of the most logical and great paced stories I've read in an visual novel. I mean everything really MADE SENSE. And the story MADE SENSE, and his personality MADE SENSE. And there was definitely character growth going on. And for what I love Cheritz the most, is that the guys have dark sides, like the bad ends can really get freaky and spooky. This means that the guys have a great dark character threat to them, which balances their over-positive aspects (e.g. Tai's personality)

Well, maybe I need to comment on a negative aspect though: It's really hard with the choises e.g. if you make one wrong one, then you are going to bad end indefinitely (i needed to do the prologue like 5 times). So I think it's a bit, you know, overdone at this point... I mean I know that easy choises won't make the game interesting, but overdoing it makes it simply frustrating at some point.

32404832.review:
I love that this game has a larger story tying together all the routes.  It creates a more satisfying sense of completion when you finish everything. A story concept that seems cute and innocent is really much more than that.  This game touches on themes of loneliness, abandonment, self worth, self hate, and acceptance.  These topics resonate, and they create an experience that is sure to stay with the player long after the game is finished.
I also recommend to play Lance, Yeonho, and Yuri before you play Tei’s route.  Some things that occur in Yuri’s route are referenced in Tei’s route.  My personal thought is to start with Yuri because his route has the least spoilers.  Playing Lance and then Yeonho after Yuri creates a really nice linear story as well.

31736828.review:
I feel like being a really elaborate ad for Cross+Ambition's BJDs hurt the game, as the message is shallow, the good endings for the boys end too abruptly to be satisfying and the secret endings were painfully obvious, LONG and boring.
Still, thumbs up because it was entertaining, even if it felt like a chore at the end.

The sprites are beautiful. The CGs are sparse and I feel like only the 3 CGs in the common route have the same quality of the sprites. Most of the CGs of the routes felt weird, be it perspective, be it anatomy... what even are necks :thinking:
The music was OK, I guess? I kept it very low because I wanted to put my own. The only memorable track is what seems to be Yuri's theme, as it's as buttery and cheesy as he is. The dub was very good, I mostly had issues with some of Hobin's lines (could hear the echo from the studio) and the voicelines after an ending (really quiet).

The high school setting was painful to read through, as it provided a cheap villain in otomes: a bunch of obsessed fangirls who harrass/kidnap/hurt MC because she is close to hot guys. Utterly stupid, almost like the overarching plot, which I don't want to spoil. Don't expect much from dolls turned human.
Route suggestion: Lance > Yeonho > Yuri > Tei > Red; Tei and Red are locked behind requirements. Follow a guide, spare yourself a headache. 
[list]
    [*]Lance is the most normal guy; by that I mean that he's a tsundere that takes a while to warm up and by the end he just throws the tsun away and aggressively pursues you. He's the most vanilla guy, and offers some decent comic relief and [i]let's be real[/i] moments.
    [*]Yeonho is you average, run-of-the-mill sweet [spoiler]little psycho[/spoiler] cutie. I love [spoiler]M[/spoiler] guys but holy fuck he was high maintenance. I liked the bad ending in which [spoiler]MC becomes a yandere lol[/spoiler].
    [*]Yuri is a walking innuendo and his interactions with the others are usually fun. He's a bit more deep than just a flirt, which made me warm up to him fast. Loved the bad ending in which [spoiler]he leaves to become a prostitute LOL[/spoiler]. MC learns a valuable lesson in this rote: how to brush her own hair!
    [*]Tei's nickname is [i]momma[/i] as he basically is the glue that keeps the household a functioning one, on top of having a part time job, on top of being a yandere. IDK I was expecting more from him but nothing in his route really scared me... the setting is high school so you can imagine how deep the abuse can go. BL games spoilt me rotten, some [spoiler]spiked tea[/spoiler] is nothing tragic especially when in the good end [spoiler]he repents and doesn't need to hurt MC anymore[/spoiler]. 
    [*]Red's raison d'être is being a super hero, and he's cutely dumb and energetic. Maybe it's because I come from Amnesia and Ozmafia, but [spoiler]I'm sick and tired of amnesia being used as plot device. Didn't fully enjoy his route because of it[/spoiler]. Long route full of misunderstandings and suprise bad endings.
 [*]The secret character appears in the endings of all the boys, and starts popping up during the routes of Tei and Red. [spoiler]I made the mistake of naming him Dolly, my first teddy's name. His character design insults my eyes and his two secret endings are predictable, long and made me feel annoyed at his shallowness, which I guess is not the intended outcome. But the fact that [i]they're just dolls[/i] and the message is [i]don't forget old toys[/i] is really not worth my 30 hours investment, especially when my romances with the other guys vanished in thin air like that[/spoiler].
[*] I wish there was a route for Soi and Shinbi, as they're great friends and Soi positively impressed me [spoiler]in Tei's route. Hoes before bros! QUEEN[/spoiler]. Yujin felt very... shocking for the sake of it. Zion and Hobin were ok.
[/list]
MC was not as terrible as I expected; she had a good troll face, could [i]selectively[/i] snap back and had a life. Also, she didn't have amnesia [spoiler]mostly[/spoiler] and had social awareness! But the game downplays the romances for the sake of the overarching plot, which is really not that great. It's almost like they forcibly stuck to the theme and sabotaged themselves in the process.

There's a lot of criticism in this review despite the thumbs up because ultimately I found it entertaning. I expected more, but it's a good otome to read with recognizable tropes, an overarching story and collectables.

31546289.review:
Fantastic Game.

I cried more than once and after completing the whole game [spoiler] including both secret endings, I hugged all of my stuffed animals and sobbed; this story touched me deeply as I've always felt like my toys had personality and I know I've forgotten at least one or two over the years. [/spoiler]

Okay, enough of that. Down to brass tacks. The UI is good, the storyline (while it does have a couple holes here and there) is enjoyable, the characters are pretty well written, and the artwork is beautiful. There are a lot of memoirs/extras to collect and a large number of different endings, mostly bad... although there are a few "Bad Ends" I didn't mind at all... [spoiler] After all, who doesn't want to be shared by two hot guys...? Triangle, anyone? 💕 [/spoiler]

Minor grammatical mistakes and misspelling throughout, but I was so immersed in the story that it didn't bother me in the slightest.

Definitely worth the cash, if you like VNs with tragic characters and bittersweet endings.

...I enjoyed mystic messenger and that's why I ended up here...However I really want to roll my eyes  for the following reasons:

It feels like I've been cheated by the game(also the boys will feel the same, I suppose), not only emotionaly but also physically (my money, let's be real this game is REALLY not cheap). 

-"Be pretty for me.""You don't know that I've been watching you all the time?""I will lock her up.(or something similar)""I don't like that (when MC is busy talking to her friends)"etc. I mean, really? Leave me alone.

Yeah maybe she is someone he likes but unless something meaningful/symbolic happens to him for him to realize the problem and fix it HIMSELF or with others' help, I can't see otherwise.

-About the main charactor(MC), I understand how she feels about losing her grandfather(thust me, I really do), but it is not like the world is going to make things easier for you just because of that. In addition, the crush she has on the boy appears too early, I don't even see why/how she likes him at that point.

-Last but not least, BUGS. I was thinking about reporting them but there are too many:

4. Sometimes when you load, there is no respond no matter how long you wait. You need to quit Steam completely and try again.

In conclusoion I feel nothing good/worth to remember (Ironically it is thw title is "The one thing you must recall") towards this game. Refund, please.

The BGM is good though, that's it.

30837898.review:
Nameless is a step up from Dandelion ~ my opinion. There are no god forsaken stat building in Nameless like in Dandelion. 

Pros:
1. Unlike Dandelion there is an in depth story rather than the majority of it being stat building like in Dandelion.
2. I guess the artwork is good. I definitely cannot draw this well, but when Yuri closes his eyes...what the heck is that?!
3. I am not sure IF it is a better story or not. There is MORE story, which is good, but I feel less silliness in dandelion...if you can believe that. I am not sure if that is really accurate though, if Dandelion had more story, would it be as silly?! Who knows? They are both pretty silly if you think about it. 
4. I like how they kept up the mystery of the nameless doll the MC had forgotten about until the end. 
5. Funny moments...[spoiler] Yuri is funny in that he is an extreme flirt to the point that even though he is a teacher he has no shame in flirting anyway. So, yeah, that was sort of funny. Lance does the play with Red in the good end of his route. Red being all jealous in thinking the MC liked someone else was sort of cute and funny when he splutters nonsense for a second and everyone thinks he has the hots for another guy. "sigh" Yeah as far as I remember these were the only moments that stood out. [/spoiler]
6. You have dialogue options...unfortunately not many as several other otome games I played. =/

Cons:
1. I often feel like this story was written by a 12-year-old (actually I felt that way about Dandelion too, but stat building hides it better). Some of the concepts are so ridiculous, but I suppose it is entertainingly funny in how some of the concepts are so ridiculous. [spoiler] I cannot, nor will not, ever enjoy the idea that a. dolls came to life. b. become nicknamed the hot5. c. apparently so "breathtakingly gorgeous" the MC can barely talk to them without all the other girls wanting to threaten her for being so lucky to hang out with them. "gag!" I think with all this combined I had often sat there wondering about my own life choices in playing this game, as well as wonder if the MC, in truth, has mental issues. I do not say this to make fun of those that truly have issues, but I have a hard time understanding how I can relate to these fictional people to real people. All the girls at the school freak out when they see these characters. You might as well put a cow bell around their necks and imagine them as dogs drooling over their loved ones. I have never seen girls act so shameless and pathetic in real life. Especially not so many girls all at once comprising an entire school. Since people DO NOT NORMALLY ACT THIS WAY...I wonder if the MC is just imagining seeing these dolls alive and human. Yeah, I am sorry for this rant, but this was hard to choke down. They need to step up with better conflict than this headache.  [/spoiler]

2. The end is abrupt I suppose it was meant that way. [spoiler] The MC wins the love of her chosen doll and the wizard takes her to another alternate reality so she can try to win another piece aka another doll's love of these five. They all get together for the finale - all the dolls remember loving and giving their love to the MC, but apparently, none remember not having her love in the other routes. My guess? There are alternate non-loved dolls that just disappear to who knows where. If it sounds weird. It kind of is. Sorry, this is pretty much how this story goes. [/spoiler]

3. The MC is not totally bad as far as some go for otome games (whyyyy??! do they do this???!), but so far the MC from dandelion is actually the best. 

4. I hate that one character that keeps calling the MC 'master'. What kind of weird fantasies do these writers think normal people like?! Okay, okay. I get it is his character and that the MC is apparently owner of the dolls and that is where it is coming from...but gees. I dunno. 

5. These dolls all have personal issues, but resolving those issues with the thing they needed (learning to trust, learning to love, being honest, etc.,) seem to fall short.  I ask myself...did they really resolve them? I think it falls short because they combined the MC earning their love at the SAME time as these characters resolving their personal issues. As a result, it sort of downplays how they actually and truly resolve their issues.  Future reference: save the acknowledgement of love for a bit later in the story instead of rushing it at the same time these characters overcome their personal issues. 

6. The whole point of the story? [spoiler] Some dolls have souls (or all of them? This was never clear) and they are important so you should not forget them and remember to love them or they might get upset and have issues. I suppose as a side note there is a wizard who needs memories to retain his powers, but this time the wizard stands in the background in comparison to Dandelion. This is the w h o l e point of this story. [/spoiler]

7. Dialogue options are few and the few choices you have can so easily lead to a terrible end or a boring bad end. The terrible ends are not so bad per say, but the boring ones end so abruptly and with little explanation. They might as well, in those ends, immediately bring up the "bad end" sign and add a "you suck" to it. 

I guess I could go on, but getting tired of writing. I just hope I wrote this well enough to make an honest review. I do not hate this game, but I do not love it. I wish Steam let you have a middle ground choice instead of "do you recommend this game or not?" Since I have mixed feelings, I won't pick the recommendation.

30424986.review:
I got this game after playing hours of Mystic Messenger in the summer. People here kept saying that because both are made by Cheritz, the games are alike. Unfortunately, that's not true.
About a third of this game was genuinely good, I guess it just depends if you like the characters enough. Even on my favourite roots I found myself skipping some boring scenes. A lot of my playtime was spent skipping really. The story is naive and slow, and some of the characters are not who they seem to be, but at this stage we all know the generic otome tropes so it's hardly a surprise who is gonna be weird in what way. The "shocking" and "dark" storyline doesn't even compare to the stuff you'd see on Netflix, so I'm confused about why people think it's so intense.
I guess for me the big disappointment was that unlike in Mystic Messenger, where the characters are rational adults, here you play exactly what you're given: a meek highschooler. Again, it's such an overused trope, and I could not relate to the "Heroine" at all.
You should probably spend your money on something better. There are some great otome games out there, and this is not one of them.

30079763.review:
С это новеллой я познакомилась благодаря Mystic Messenger, новелле, которая на мой взгляд сделана довольно не плохо. Сама новелла мне понравилась, были детали, которые вызывали у меня негодование. В одном из рутов в CG не было закрашено плечо, это конечно недостаток, но он незаметен. Достаточно интересный сюжет, легко читается, персонажи МОРГАЮТ, прекраная корейская озвучка. Самый торт конечно это то, что в этой новелле все персонажи являются реальными куклами. 

Сюжет развивается быстро, после прохождения некоторых рутов, казалось, что заканчиваются они одинаково (всё кончалось рождеством). Нам предоставляется на выбор 5 мужиков, которых можно закадрить, каждый персонаж не похож на предыдущего и это плюс. Если познакомиться с другими продуктами Cheritz, то можно заметить некоторое сходство некоторых персонажей. Например Yeon-ho и Yoosung, как мне кажется, очень похожи не только именами и внешностью,  но и характером, но это всё не так важно. Саундтрек здесь не плохой, но местами надоедал.

Очень понравилось что все руты связаны между собой, да, помимо отдельных сюжетов здесь есть один общий, но чтобы полностью его раскрыть, нужно пройти все руты. 
За раскрытием персонажей в каждом руте было очень интересно наблюдать, к концу рута ваше представение о персонаже может совершенно отличаться от того, какое оно было в начале. Так же в этой новелле главная героиня ИМЕЕТ СВОЙ ХАРАКТЕР, ведь обычно в подобных новеллах у главных героинь нет какого-то особенно выделяющегося характера и своей супер истории.

Секретный персонаж, который здесь представлен, наверно понравился мне больше всех, но сначала я испытала к нему отвращение, наверно из-за того, каким нам его представили художники, но у каждого своё мнение на этот счёт. [spoiler] Когда узнала что секретный персонаж это плюшевый медведь, жутко орнула[/spoiler] 



Я бы не сказала что в этой новелле всё хорошо, но всё же она мне понравилась. Большое спасибо разработчикам.

29167092.review:
[h1][i]Когда разработчики визуальных новелл сотрудничают с компанией по производству ball jointed dolls, вместо игры получается [b]сладкая пироженка[/b].[/i][/h1]

Я люблю жанр [i]otome[/i] хотя бы за то, что в качественных подобных играх всё создаются исключительно для услаждения девичьего взгляда: от визуальной составляющей, озвучки и до непосредственного сюжета. 

А [b]Nameless ~ The one thing you must recall[/b] безусловно одна из наиболее качественных визуальных новелл этого жанра. Мой взгляд был услаждён буквально полностью <3.

Всё в игре прекрасно: персонажи, фоны, музыкальное сопровождение, общий сюжет, сюжеты роутов и, что довольно редко, главная героиня с характером и личностью. 

Персонажи были разработаны в сотрудничестве с корейской компанией [b]Crobidoll[/b], они  созданы по типам реальных кукол этой компании. Результат меня очень порадовал: герои получились очень красивыми. 

Хотя “оживляет” нарисованных мальчиков больше всё же отличная озвучка. Голоса настолько приятные и очень точно подобранные, что спустя три дня после полного прохождения игры я всерьез скучаю по ним. Особенно по очаровательному [i]“my honey~”[/i] с корейским акцентом. 

Сюжеты роутов вполне вписываются в рамки подростковых лайт-романов, происходящих в декорациях школы. Каждый роут особенный, тематикой и развитием очень отличающийся от остальных. Не смотря даже на уровень моих симпатий к тому или иному герою, все роуты проходить было интересно. 

Сюжеты хорошо раскрывают и так же “оживляют” рисованных героев, ближе к концу сюжета я чувствовала реальную симпатию к персонажу. Честно говоря, мой внутренний рейтинг персонажей к концу прохождения поменялся и результат меня саму очень даже удивил, и всё из-за сюжетов. 

Больше всего мне понравилось, как шло раскрытие характеров по мере сюжета. К концу роутов раскрывались мотивы героев, их страхи, их желания, а так же «реальный» характер. Честно, впервые вижу в [i]otome[/i] настолько хорошо проработанных персонажей. Не скажу, что у меня огромный опыт в подобных играх, и всё же эта игра меня очень впечатлила. 

Так же в игре есть «общий» сюжет, куда в итоге стекаются все остальные. Наличие такого «второго плана» тоже играет в пользу общего восприятия. Игра выглядит куда серьезнее, чем кажется на первый взгляд. Для полного восприятия всей игры необходимо пройти роуты всех персонажей и познакомиться с секретным. Ох, мне это таааак понравилось <3

Ещё важная деталь: главная героиня. Обычно в играх подобного жанра героини являются некой «тенью» для более простой подстановки игроком самого себя на место самого главного героя. В этой же игре героиня имеет свой характер (хоть и слегка “замороженный”) и за ней не менее приятно наблюдать. 

Мне ооооочень понравилось! Такие игрушки… Они как десерт. Хорошие, приятные, сладкие. Мне было даже как-то жаль заканчивать прохождение, так я привязалась к героям. Они правда милые и классные. И игра такая <3

[h1]Я рекомендую [b]Nameless ~The one thing you must recall[/b] любой, кто ищет качественное и приятное [i]otome[/i].[h1]

29151613.review: I can't express enough how much I loved this game. I've honestly never felt so moved and emotional by a game before. I fell in love with all of the characters, especially the five main boys. They are all so unique and different from one another, the diversity is quite nice, and I know at least one boy will appeal to you. This game helped me when I was feeling lonely or sad, it cheered me up and put love in my heart and a smile on my face, and it felt like I was there in the game, and I could escape with romantic cute boys for a while~ This game also shouldn't be taken that lightly, yes, it looks like a very cute and romantic VN, and it is, but be careful of some of the bad endings, I swear they are nightmare fuel. some of the bad endings contain violence, and extreme obsession so if you are sensitive to that, I'd recommend you stay away from the bad endings and follow the guide for the good ending. Though just remember the bad endings also contibute to the storyline as well, so you should play every ending possible. To be more specific, the violence and extreme obsession is really only showed in Tei's and Yeon-ho's routes (which were personally my favourite because that's what I enjoy) and the rest are pretty much just adorable. The route for "???" made me cry a waterfall, and I'm not going to say more cause I don't want to spoil anything. I can't express enough how much I recommend this game, it's worth every penny. The game is so well done, the dialogue, the art, the graphics, the voices, it's all amazing. Please please get this game, you will not be disappointed in the slightest ^^

28149263.review:
[b]Nameless ~The one thing you must recall is that you’re going to cry a lot~[/b]

Dandelion is a very special game. But I must say, after playing Nameless, this one too became really important to me. My grasp on the English language is very limited, I’m sorry, but I’ll try my best to express how much this visual novel means to me.

This game will break your heart. It will break you in pieces, make you cry, and make you wish that things could’ve been different. But it will also make you smile, it will take all your broken pieces and put them together. This is without a doubt, one of the best visual novels I’ve ever played. The story is somewhat similar to Dandelion, but “darker” and most fitting to my personal taste. There’s a lot of touchy subjects such as fear of being abandoned/replaced, physical/mental abuse, obsession, etc. But nothing here is just thrown in the air, everything has an explanation, and you actually feel bad for the characters. 

My favorite route was Tei’s. My heart really ached for him, and I cried. It’s been a long time since I’ve cried because of an otome visual novel, but his past is just too much to handle. I loved all the characters, but Tei… [spoiler]I just want to hug him really tight and say he’s not broken or dirty.[/spoiler] He’s special.

The “true ending” blew my f*cking mind. I won’t spoil it, you’ll have to play the game. But I can tell you this: prepare your tissues because you’re going to cry [b]a lot[/b]. [spoiler]Not in a bad way, I guess.[/spoiler] Cheritz is a really amazing developer team, their games have an unique style. I’m looking forward to play more of Mystic Messenger too, and I wish they can make another PC visual novel soon.

Yes, there are flaws in Nameless. But f*ck it. 10/10, totally worth every cent and if I could, I’d buy everything again.

27843775.review:
Ce qui distingue Nameless des autres otome games ? Sa qualité d'écriture, ses images et sa bande-son. Sans oublier le doublage, qui est lui aussi très bien réalisé. Chaque voix colle superbement bien aux caractères des personnages et il contribue grandement à donner vie à ces derniers, à véhiculer des émotions et à s'immerger dans l'histoire.
Là où certains otome games rendent l'héroïne passive du début à la fin, j'ai beaucoup aimé le fait qu'Eri aide les garçons à tour de rôle à s'accomplir en tant que personne. Et même si les 5 garçons ont des personnalités très différentes, on s'attache facilement à chacun d'eux et aucun ne nous laisse indifférente.
On prend même plaisir à observer les intéractions qu'ils ont entre eux et l'évolution de leurs relations ;)
Pour conclure, je ne peux que vous conseiller Nameless si vous chercher un otome game émouvant qui vous transporte dans la magie de son monde !

27777897.review:
This game is definitely recommended. The art is decent enough considering its price. The voice-acting is truly something to rave about, with every line potraying the relevant emotions clearly. Every route is written in-depth, and there is an excellent overarching plot tying everything together. Even if the characters aren't your cup of tea, at the end of the game, you will be able to appreciate them for who they are and who they have grown into. 

Of course, like in every other game, there are also flaws - the typos, the occassional awkward CG, but that's not what is truly important. This game is able to narrate a unique, wholesome, tear-jerking story that is interesting and varied. There's a melancholic, pervasive quality to many scenes, so much so that you get emotionally invested in the characters. Most of all, through presenting the stories of a few individuals, this game made me think more about dolls, human beings, and the world at large. 

Spectacular, and in my humble opinion, well worth the buck.

27619270.review:
Well worth the price, Nameless is undoubtedly the most well written visual novel I have ever played. Its depth and complexity took me by surprise, romance aside the plot is not at all what is expected and very well done. Emotive and full of heart, the core messages of this game are beautiful. I could go on and on and on but, the short version is simply that this game is truly beautiful. 

Writing aside, the art is really nice, the voice acting adds a lot to the game (yes, even though it's in Korean) and as mentioned by many other players, there are typos, but they are sparse and don't really take away from the game. It's well scored; music, art and writing working together to create a story that will undoubtedly surprise you.

 The characters all feel (ironically) quite human, and for the first time in any otome-type game I enjoyed every single character route immensely. The best part, the crowning achievement of Nameless for me, is the way the character arcs were handled. Every character had their flaws, and these flaws were not ignored or brushed over, or highlighted yet left unconfronted, or worse, glorified (EG AMNESIA). They were handled exceptionally well. Everyone deserves to be loved. Certain characters rang alarm bells for me after bad experiences with previous otome games but nothing was as it seemed. Whoops, I said I wouldn't ramble so I'll wrap it up.

This is an otome game, and thusly it is definitely directed at women but honestly, I would reccomend this game to any fan of visual novels or interactive stories, regardless of gender or sexual preference. You'll get more out of it if you like romance games, of course, but all round it's a lovingly crafted story about so much more than love. I was extremely skeptical heading into this game (just as I was before playing Dandelion - Wishes Brought To You) but once again, Cheritz took me on a surprising journey I won't forget anytime soon. I wish there were more games like this!

27497575.review:
First of all, I'm super grateful to Cheritz that almost all their games are available on Steam. Not a common case, right? Most otome-games are published for PS Vita, so Cheritz immediately got my loyalty.
One of the strongest points of this game is its setting. Have you ever pitied your old abandoned toys when you started to grow up? Have you ever thought that virtual persons (dolls, fiction characters, idols of all sorts) are more reliable and safe for close relationships than real people? Have you thought that those abandoned by us still remember everything? The game will give you time to think over this stuff.
'Nameless' protagonist has her precious ball-joint dolls suddenly turned into people. Every doll has its initial program, the number of features created by a puppet-maker. When turned into human every doll is doomed to strong character development. It's quite interesting to watch how the circumstances make everyone widen their horizon. 
So, the obvious pros of the game are:
- Interesting setting.
- Visible character development.
- Strong protagonist. Eri is not a typical otome heroine, what a relief. 
- Interesting characters. BTW, the cast has two yanderes. It's up to you if you like it or not but they are well written. Side characters are also attractive. 
- Tons of various bad endings. 
- Beautiful artwork. There are many CGs, rather detailed and nice. The art is much better than you find in average otome game. The backgrounds are rather poor though. The characters are animated. 
- All routes are connected with a common plot. In the end you will unlock a heartrending story of a secret character. 
- Gorgeous voice acting. 
- The price is rather affordable. 

Talking of cons...
- I'd say that the group interaction is rather poor. Well, Tei doesn't get along with Yuri and Lance dislikes Red... It could be more complicated. It could be better. 
- Sometimes it's all too melodramatic but we're talking about South Korea here. Wouldn't expect less from a country that makes doramas =) 

All in all, 'Nameless' is incredible. It's a high-quality otome game with interesting setting and captivating characters. Not my number one, but I'd give it the second or the third place.

I'm always a sucker for games that actually continue the plot from your first playthrough when you "replay" the game. The way that Nameless takes plot themes from the company's first game, Dandelion, and intertwines it with an Otome gamer's love for replaying a game in order to experience different routes absolutely blew me away. 

Cheritz are geniuses at the games they make, and they really nailed it with this game. The story is intense, original and fascinating, and I adored how the characters are very complex and not who you first expect. I'm not normally an Otome-gamer, but this one had me reeling and wanting to replay after I had already thrown 40+ hours into experiencing every character's route.

26611366.review:
Story: Like Dandelion (same creator), the premise is fantastical but carries a lot of dark and mature themes. The bachelors are your set of (ball-jointed) dolls come to life, who all have their own personalities based on the ones given to them by their manufacturers. It seems ideal for a while, but as you travel down their respective paths, you begin to understand the existential difficulties these guys have and how it affects their relationship with you, themselves and each other. Yes, there's angst.

Like Dandelion and Amnesia, the 'multi romances' are a factor built-in to the central plot and you'll need to go through all the routes to unlock the mysterious 'true plot', which reveals itself increasingly throughout.

Bachelors: I generally enjoy Cheritz's bachelors - they aren't safe from tropes, but they do their tropes well and add a few surprises to keep players on their toes. There are two characters with yandere-like tendencies hiding amongst a cute 'little brother', a caring 'big brother', an aloof ice prince, a playful 'best friend', and a careless playboy. 

Romances: The priority is on the emotional connection you build. This is interesting because as your dolls they already "like" you, but this is more or less a shallow reflection of what they think you want to see. Once you get more involved, its fascinating the layers that are revealed - replaying a new route after developing a previous one will help you see how distant the characters really are at the beginning. 

Art: The art remains consistent in quality, with a good amount of CGs that you can collect and review in your album.

26610282.review:
A great game. The heroine's facial expressions, storyline and humor made this an amazing play. I just love the look she gets at certain moments made me chuckle every time.
For all the darkness in the story and the mystery the heartwarming scenes and realistic way of making you question your existence is makes it well worth it.

26596956.review:
Definitely recommended.

Mystery and romance. That pretty much sums the game up without revealing too much. It also has fantasy elements to it, but the game is much more than that. The plot is interesting enough with just the mystery, fantasy and romance itself. However, the story is much deeper than that. It deals with issues that anyone of us could have, has had or might be having right now. That is what makes things game impactful. It might make you think. It might make you laugh. It might make you uncomfortable. And it might make you cry. But it's all worth it, when you finally finish that last ending.

Others have noted the same thing that I'm about to say now; even if one of them wasn't your type, most likely you'll like them all at the end. They're a nice set of characters fit for different tastes. All of them grow so much mentally and yet they still can keep that one thing that first drew me to them. They all have issues and they overcome them, not just the romanceable characters but also the heroine herself. The side characters were awesome too, so even if your chosen bishie isn't on the screen, you're most likely to enjoy your time anyway.

While I do like the art, it's not the prettiest one I've seen. Game graphics and art are what first draw me to a game. This game's art is indeed really nice, but CGs looked a bit... awkward at some points. But I'm picky when it comes to game art, so don't let it push you away from this game. It still looks really nice.

Voice acting was great. Really great. I don't understand Korean, so when one word ends and another begins put me off a bit at first. Especially if I'm trying to hear whether the voice ended or just pausing for an effect. But for me, who always keeps voices on (even the annoying ones), it's part of the appeal.

Now, that one minus part. This game has quite a few typos. It's not noticeable all the time, but you might laugh at a bit inappropriate time. But consindering it's only a one minus part, I learned to ignore it.

With only that one minus part, I can definitely recommend the game. The story is deep on the long run, the characters (hopefully) can stir your heart and it leaves an impression on you. The price might be a bit high, but there's always a game that costs even more. I got in on a sale but I saved only a few euros, so it doesn't make much difference. The game is worth the money. All of it.

26567986.review:
Nameless is an incredibly context-rich otome visual novel by Cheritz, the same company who created Mystic Messenger and Dandelion, an otome mobile app and Steam game, respectivly. I first became interested in Nameless after playing Mystic Messenger and experiencing how much care, detail, and extensive work Chertiz put into a free mobile app. I thought, surely since they put this much content and love into an app, their Steam games are worth looking into.

Though the $30 price tag may deter many from bothering to pick this game up, I can assure you it's worth every penny and urge you to reconsider.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Incredibly well written and complex (though not confusing) plot
[*]Well developed and written characters, even side characters (such as Mr. Yujin and Zion)
[*]Beautiful and expansive soundtrack
[*]High quality opening music video for the beginning of the game and ending music videos for each good ending and secret ending
[*]Fully voiced cast - from everything to side characters, flashbacks, nameless classmates, etc
[*]6 extensive routes, each with at least 3 bad endings and 5 CGs
[*]Bonuses that include diary entries expanding on characters thoughts during the game and clips of the voice actors talking about their work on the game
[*]Lots of content - a guaranteed 30+ hours of gameplay to complete all routes, collect all the bonus content, and finish the story
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]Occasional typos or missing words (though not nearly as bad as I've seen for other VNs) - very rarely would it ruin the immersion of the game for me, but I could see how it could be frustring, especially during climatic and emotional scenes
[*]While a great, well written story, there were some route endings and the final ending itself that left me really aching for more. The final ending was conslusive, but I would have like to see an after ending for even that. Perhaps that's just me being greedy for more of Cheritz's writing, however.
[*]I felt as though the MC herself was given the short end of the stick when it came to character development and dialogue. Though this is a common thing to do in otome games (airhead, flustered, clumsy girl), Nameless' MC plays such an important role for the overarching story that I felt she should have been given more consideration and development when making the game
[/list]

Overall, I 100% recommend Namless ~The one thing you must recall~ to anyone looking for a high quality and doki doki inducing otome game with a deep and intriguing plot most dating sims don't bother with. In addition, I recommend Cheritz's other two games if you're looking for the same quality, writing, and experience.

26534086.review: While it may be slow to get into, I really enjoyed the routes. Might I also add in true fashion to Cheritz, you must complete each route in a certain order to know what's going on.

(It's hard for me to say better because MM is close to my heart, but Nameless is just as close at this point.)  Using a traditional visual novel format gives Cheritz a lot of room to work, and they make the absolute best use of it.

A lot of people are saying "this is not your average visual novel, there's an overarching plot," and I just want to emphasize this 100%. I've been playing VNs for years, and I've never played one like this. While each individual route is fantastic, the air of mystery behind all of them really motivates you to play, and this game is magnificently creepy at times. I don't want to spoil anything, but the way this story is done is such a creative and effective use of the visual novel format that I was completely blown away. The overarching story here is a lot deeper than in MM, and it is fantastically executed.

On the whole ball-jointed doll concept: I honestly thought it was the most ridiculous fantasy in the world, but the story is [i]better[/i] for it. Like, it's not a weird thing you overlook because the game is so good; it [i]makes[/i] the game good. A lot of the things that are utterly unique about the characterizations and the overall story would simply not be possible if not for the fact that they're ball-jointed dolls.

Characters and individual routes are amazing. Of course, as with all games, some are better than others (I personally found Yuri's to be the blandest, though I did enjoy his), but even the ones where you're not interested because you want to marry the character or something are still page-turners. The characters are all subversions of standard character types: the kuudere, the shota, the ladykiller, the gentle mom-type, the silly boyish type (I recognize the last one isn't a standard type, but please work with me), and as you delve deeper into their true characters, you start needing to realize why they are the way they are. It's really well-executed; only once does their reasoning behind characterization seem to fall flat, but you let it go because the characterization is just that interesting. 

Speaking of individual routes, by the way, I heavily advise you stick to the order the game wants you play the routes in: Lance > Yuri or Yeonho > Tei > Red. Lance is honestly one of my favorite routes and I don't really like to tell you to play it first, but in terms of mystery, Lance's route really reveals nothing. It's just a very good route. Also, make sure to play with the Steam Guide and get every bad end. They're super creepy and super enjoyable, and they also reveal stuff about the overarching plot.

On the technical aspect: amazing voice acting and you can look at the character art for yourself. As well as that, the main character is really sweet and not a pushover. Even if she's a little slow at times, she's cute and nice so it's okay. The rest of the side characters also have really strong personalities, and the minigames are pretty easy.

I know the price is pretty steep, but I assure you that if you can pay it, it's worth it. I'm in Nameless hell. Please play this game.

25829577.review:
After about 25ish hours I did finally manage to get all the good endings (I was too lazy to try and get all the bad endings. It's up to personal preference really on that aspect.)

Before I really get into the review, I would like to point out a few things first - 
Like many VNs, the beginning portion is usually quite similar through each run, and then it branches off depending on who you have the highest affinity with. But with this game it has a nice mechanic that when you start the game, you kind of get to choose who you want to pursue. You have the choice of picking the Lance, Yeon-Ho, Yuri route (which begins with the same first few chapters despite small difference depending on the choices you choose, and then branching off with the guy you have the highest affection with.) and then you have the option for Tei and Red's route - which starts off completely different and the whole game plays out with your character pursing that one from the start. It's a similar mechanic to the Norn9 stuff, and it's up to preference. I know a lot of people like playing the game blind and then depending on the character's looks/personality/traits etc. they decide who they want to go for in the moment, but me, being a lazy person, I usually just pull up a walkthrough and go through it without much thought. 
So I personally don't find that mechanic to be bad, but it's up to you.

Now, for the actual review!!

Nameless has a solid story that addresses many deeper topics such as abuse, abandonment, and loss. It handles these topics quite nicely, and leaves you with a better understanding of said topics.
It's not as 'metophoric' as some other games, but I personally think it's better because it really hits home how these situations affect others and even yourself. 

To be bluntly honest, at around my second/third route I was beginning to get a little irritated with a few things, but the two secret endings overshadowed any of that left me in tears, which I think is enough.

Pros

- At first, each character seems to fit into each different archtype (cold silent type, loli, big brother, romatic, etc...) which seemed kind of lazy to me, but once you go down the paths you can see how much personality they actually have.

- The art is pleasing to the eye, and the character designs are unique and lovely.

- The story puts you on an emotional roller coaster. You will be laughing and having a grand old time one minute, and then crying the next.

- Each character is different. They have different flaws and different likes/dislikes. No character is 'perfect' which leaves them feeling human.

- In my case, I actually felt jealous and a little upset depending on different factors, which is another way that the game plays with your emotions - keeping you constantly enthralled in the story.

- The voice acting, especially for ??? is some of the best I've heard. Whenever ??? speaks I feel like I am feeling exactly what he is. The anguish, the sorrow, the anger... It is all perfectly conveyed through the voice actor. 

Cons

- The protagonist, Eri, is a little 'too' innocent for me. Problems with simple solutions can take her chapters to fix. She always seems clueless and that kind of took me out of the story. In most situations she is fine and relateable, but in others I would find myself hitting my head against my desk because she was too innocent. (Incoming rant) I have dealt with clueless/innocent characters before, but they were different. Cardia (from Code: Realize) spent her entire life locked up in a mansion, so when she finally leaves it she doesn't know much of anything. The story made it so that there was a reason why she didn't know much of anything, so that kept it from being annoying. Another example is the Heroine from Amnesia Memories - she starts off the game with Amnesia so she doesn't know anything. Meanwhile, in Nameless, even though at some points Eri does experience amnesia, from the start she is very innocent without much reason to be. This might not be a problem for everyone, but it was just annoying for me. You don't notice it all the time, but when it did happen it was aggrivating. 

- Like many different VNs translated to English, there are typos. Now, I've kind of grown used to this after years of playing different Visual Novels, so it doesn't bother me too much. It's not too often and even if it does break imersion for a few moments you can still understand what is going on.


All and all, I think this is a great Visual Novel for anyone who likes Otome or Cheritz. So if you have a passion for Visual Novels I really think you'll like it. A unique story, fun characters, great music and voice acting... It may not be the best one I have ever played, but it is definately up there!

The prologue can seem long and the common routes (Yuri, Yeonho, Lance) can be a bit tedious in the beginning, but they're well worth it. I played in the order of Yuri - Lance - Yeonho - Tei - Red; I believe this order will allow for you to unveil parts of the story more naturally, and I think I had a fantastic experience by following this order. 24736045.review:
This game is a lot of things. A feels trip is just one of them. 

Like any Otome or Visual Novel, the plot and characters are the backbone making up Nameless, and Cheritz has executed them very well. The characters in particular are all lovable and/or sympathetic, some more than others (but that is usually up to the player's own personal preference). That being said, I'd like to give a small round of applause for Cheritz' brilliant move of having a character from Dandelion (one of their other Otome games), be integral to Nameless' plot. The MC, Eri, is also quite relatable. She's quirky, sassy and down to earth, making for some hilarious moments. 

The art and music are very soothing to look at and listen to, with purplish hues and tones adding to the atmosphere. The graphics and interface are great, and the localization is also well done, with proper English grammar and spelling mostly consistent throughout the game. The plot itself is intriguing and mysteriously sinister, with dark themes scattered throughout. Don't expect this to be a light-hearted read; interacting with the boys and learning about the true plot behind the scenes, you may very well end up shedding a tear or two. 

That being said, there ARE trigger warnings, such as abuse and abandonment. And a lot of them, too. So be wary of that if you are sensitive to such things. 

I'd give Nameless an overall 8.5/10. It's a solid game with a lot going for it. Definetely worth your time and money.

Nameless n’a tout simplement rien à voir par rapport aux autres Otome-game, tout d’abord son scénario est tout simplement incroyable et très bien travaillée, l’excellent jeu de la voix des acteurs donne un côté extrêmement immersif, il en est de même pour sa bande-son. Le chara-design des personnes est magnifique et bien travaillé.
Le scénario de Namelesss est tout simplement incroyable qui est pensée au détails près , chaque geste, la façon dont le jeu est construit , sa mécanique  etc. Tout a une place et  fait partie du scénario. Je recommande tout simplement ce jeu, tout particulèrement Cheritz qui fait un travail remarquable sur l’otome game, et je peux dire honnêtement qu’il rehausse le genre de l’otome-game qui bien souvent est encore pétrie dans de nombreux clichés, un scénario peu cohérent, crédible , ou encore un manque de profondeur des personnages. 

Bref vous ne trouverez pas ces gros défauts que l’on peut retrouver au sein de grand nombre d’otome-game car tout simplement Nameless va au-delà de l’otome-game et ce par les différents thèmes qui sont abordées (la question de l’identité, l’abus, l’attachement etc.) J’écris ces mots quelques jours après avoir terminer le jeu (avec toutes les fins possibles etc.) et je peux dire que je souhaite rejouer  l’ensemble du jeu de nouveau car ce jeu m’a laissé songeuse, m’a fait rire, m’a donner des frayeurs mais m’a aussi fait verser qq larmes. Bref Nameless est un vrai petit bijou et je ne peux que recommander ! Le prix peut être gênant pour certains mais sachez que la somme que vous mettrez sera tout simplement bien investie :D Mais si ce jeu fait partie de votre bibliothèque je vous garantie que  c’est un ticket direct pour Feeladelphia !

23925242.review:
My first review!

So I brought this game waaaaaayyy back even before they had it release on steam. Later I found out that they had it release on steam, so I thought, ah what the hell, might as well. Since I suspect Cheritz was merely promoting their games, I kinda doubt they had added any extra content to it. And I was right. Not that its a bad thing.
 
Artwork: 9/10
So I played through the game like normal, from Lance to the 'first doll you received'. First things first though. Lemme just squeel on the beautiful artwork. I mean, how could you not!? I'm talking about BEAUTIFUL. I'd rush to the nearest store if I ever find out they are selling Nameless posters and wallpaper. So there you go, superbly beautiful artwork.

Story: 3.5/10
Well, about this part, I have to say that it was kind of a let down. For almost half of the time, I think I nearly slept through some of the characters path (I'm looking at you, Red and Yeon Ho). And the main character's awfully bland personality didn't help spice up the story either. I mean sure, you got beautiful drawn characters and CG, but at the end of the day, its the story that counts. Look at Higurashi, Umineko and erm, Touhou? They both had crap artwork, but at the very least, story was fascinating enough for people to overlook that 'art'.

Soundtrack: 6/10
The soundtrack was comforting and relaxing, too bad the music is not my kind of taste. Still, I know beautiful music when I hear one, so hats off to Shinjou Hanabi for creating music that matched the game's atmosphere and 'school' theme.

Character: 5/10
I wasn't expecting much the moment I saw the female MC. At that instant I knew she is definitely going to be bland. Boy I was right. Not to mention she was SUPER DUPER dense. Holy Jesus and blessed Mary. I can't count the number of times I was screaming at the screen yelling "WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU SENPAI NOTICED YOU STOP PLAYING DUMB". Being dense makes the situation hilarious, but TOO dense is the ultimate (okay, maybe not ultimate, but close enough) recipe for character disaster. Its a huge relieft to find out at least the boys have unique personalities from kuu-tsundere clingy playboy yandere naive yangire (I think?). Gotta admit that even Soi's dramatic comments made me laugh more than the boys did. Seriously, that's even the reason why the ratings are like bare-minimum pass.

Translation: 8/10
I've certainly seen better translated games in my life, but that's not to say Nameless isn't good. In fact I think they did a good job translating it, with a few minor hiccups here and there which can easily be overlooked since its mainly grammar problems. Language is easy to grasp so I doubt anyone would have even a single problem understanding any of the scripts.

Overall: 6/10
Since its only my opinion and I'm a little extremely biased AGAINST bland female MC, so there might be prejudice here and there. However, if you don't mind the female MC being of plain character, then you might enjoy the game more than I did. Hopefully.
